 RUNNING = ::CTK_SPE_STATUS_RUNNING

enum  SpeStatus {
  UNKNOWN = ::CTK_SPE_STATUS_UNKNOWN, CREATED = ::CTK_SPE_STATUS_CREATED, LOADED = ::CTK_SPE_STATUS_LOADED, READY = ::CTK_SPE_STATUS_READY,
  RUNNING = ::CTK_SPE_STATUS_RUNNING, STOPPED = ::CTK_SPE_STATUS_STOPPED
}

Detailed Description

SPE generic interface

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum ctk::Spe::SpeStatus

SPE status

Enumerator:
UNKNOWN  unknown or error
CREATED  created
LOADED  program loaded
READY  thread is ready to run
RUNNING  running
STOPPED  stopped

_T &  data 
) [inline]

DMA get operation with BARRIER for constant-size transfer

Parameters:
[in] data - the LS data to be filled
[in] ea_addr - source EA addr (must be 16-byte aligned)
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno (non-zero) on failure

int ctk::Spe::getfMemory ( ls_addr_t  ls_addr,
void *  ea_addr,
dma_size_t  size 
) [inline]

DMA get operation with FENCE

Note:
for small-size transfer you should try getf_small() instead.
Parameters:
[in] ls_addr - destination LS addr (must be 16-byte aligned)
[in] ea_addr - source EA addr (must be 16-byte aligned)
[in] size - transfer size (must be 16-byte aligned)
Returns:
CTK_SUCCESS (0) on success, errno (non-zero) on failure

virtual int ctk::Spe::readIntrMbox ( unsigned int &  data  )  [inline, virtual]

Reads a 32-bit data from OUT Interrupt mbox [Non-blocking]

Parameters:
[out] the read data
Returns:
1 if the data is read, 0 otherwise
See also:
ctk_mbox_read
Exceptions:
Error on error

virtual void ctk::Spe::writeSignalRegister ( SignalRegister::reg  reg,
ctk_uint32_t  data 
) [inline, virtual]

Writes the data to the signal notification register specified by reg. [This will block until the SPE starts if it has not yet started]

Parameters:
[in] reg - specifies the signal notification register to be written. The value should be one of either SignalRegister::reg1 or SignalRegister::reg2.
[in] data - the 32-bit data to be written
See also:
ctk_signal_write
Exceptions:
Error on error

virtual void ctk::Spe::writeSignalRegister1 ( unsigned int  data  )  [inline, virtual]

Writes the data to the signal notification register 1.

Parameters:
[in] data - the 32-bit data to be written
Exceptions:
Error on error
See also:
ctk_signal_write_reg1

[in] data - the 32-bit data to be written
Exceptions:
